bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: I tested mediawriter on Fedora 25 Xfce. The mediawriter's icon on the panel is a default one, definitely different from the one showed on the menu. However, I'm setting severity as "low", since this doesn't affect the functionality of the software (well, it's more like an "RFE" for future releases, than a bug report).
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): mediawriter-3.97.2-0.fc25.i686
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install and launch mediawriter on Fedora 25 Xfce
Actual results: 1. The panel's icon is a standard one.
Expected results: 1. It would be nice if users see mediawriter's menu icon instead of a default one.
Thank you for the report. This was most likely fixed in the upstream version with a new icon (that's now provided in multiple resolutions).
mediawriter-4.0.0-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-10ffb404a4

mediawriter-4.0.0-2.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-10ffb404a4
mediawriter-4.0.0-2.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
